function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate adoption of bio-sensors and smart sanitation technology in infrastructure and sanitation products","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to contaminated wastewater with pathogens","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High demand for the health system and availability of intensive care","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate wastewater management and treatment","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of building information modeling bim and knowledge management km","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of robotics in covid-19 response introduces new technology risks","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The usage of mobile apps for covid-19 contact tracing presents privacy and trade-off considerations","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Absence of a decentralized peer-to-peer system on information systems among apps and phones","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper use of bluetooth receivers in public places for contact mapping of infected patients","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of cryptographic protocols without compromising the privacy and ethics of the patients","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cybersecurity, privacy, and ethics concerns related to digital contact tracing apps for covid-19","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quick and early detection of the disease","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of contamination due to single-use sensors","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate manufacturing capacity to meet sensor demand","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adoption of biosensors for disease surveillance","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Digital twin systems for water and wastewater management may pose a cybersecurity risk, leading to potential sabotage or disruption of critical infrastructure","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decentralized water and wastewater treatment without proper simulation and control measures can lead to the spread of waterborne diseases, including covid-19","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate optimization of treatment plant performance can result in the ineffective removal of pollutants, including emerging pollutants, from the water supply","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of early detection of emerging pollutants in the water in covid-19 diagnosis and prediction","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of blockchain technology for health passports","category":"Healthcare","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use
